intro: Zornia pratensis subsp. barbata, commonly known as the hairy zornia, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in racemes, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands, and is often found in prairie and riparian ecosystems. Zornia pratensis subsp. barbata is a perennial herb that plays a role in soil stabilization and provides forage for wildlife.
